intro: Cattleya schroederae var. alba, commonly known as the White Schröder's Cattleya, is a rare and exquisite orchid native to the rainforests of Brazil. This variant is distinguished by its pure white petals and sepals, which contrast beautifully with its deep green foliage. It belongs to the Cattleya genus, known for its showy, fragrant blooms and popularity among orchid enthusiasts. The plant typically produces large, semi-circular flowers that bloom in late summer or early autumn. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a challenging plant to cultivate and is highly sought after in the horticultural community.
